topics.content: Computer architecture basics, binary numbers, programming languages overview
Primitive types, type conversion, input/output operations
If-else statements, switch cases, conditional logic
For loops, while loops, nested loops, loop control
Function definition, parameters, return values, scope
Array operations, list comprehensions, multi-dimensional arrays
String manipulation, formatting, regular expressions basics
Reading/writing files, CSV processing, exception handling
Debugging techniques, unit testing, test-driven development
Complete software project incorporating all concepts

textbooks: Think Python: How to Think Like a Computer Scientist by Allen Downey
Python Crash Course by Eric Matthes

cs.name: Data Structures and Algorithms
cs.description: Fundamental data structures and algorithm design techniques

objectives: Implement core data structures from scratch
Select appropriate data structures for problems

topics.content: Big-O notation, time/space complexity, asymptotic analysis
Static vs dynamic arrays, amortized analysis, ArrayList implementation
Singly/doubly linked lists, circular lists, skip lists
Binary trees, tree traversals, binary search trees
AVL trees, Red-Black trees, B-trees basics
Hash functions, collision resolution, load factors

textbooks: Introduction to Algorithms (CLRS) by Cormen, Leiserson, Rivest, and Stein
Algorithm Design by Kleinberg and Tardos

cs.name: Computer Architecture
cs.description: Computer organization, assembly language, and system design

objectives: Understand CPU architecture and instruction sets

topics.content: Binary arithmetic, floating point, character encoding
RISC vs CISC, MIPS ISA, addressing modes
Cache design, cache coherence, virtual memory

textbooks: Computer Organization and Design by Patterson and Hennessy
Computer Systems: A Programmer's Perspective by Bryant and O'Hallaron

cs.name: Operating Systems
cs.description: Design and implementation of operating systems

topics.content: History, types, system calls, kernel vs user mode
Process creation, PCB, context switching, scheduling
User vs kernel threads, thread pools, threading models
FCFS, SJF, priority, round-robin, multilevel queues

textbooks: Operating System Concepts by Silberschatz, Galvin, and Gagne
Operating Systems: Three Easy Pieces by Arpaci-Dusseau

topics.content: B+ trees, hash indexes, bitmap indexes
Query optimization, execution plans, cost estimation

textbooks: Database System Concepts by Silberschatz, Korth, and Sudarshan
Database Management Systems by Ramakrishnan and Gehrke

topics.content: Internet architecture, protocol layers, network edge/core
UDP, TCP, reliable data transfer, flow control
WiFi, cellular, mobile IP, ad hoc networks

textbooks: Computer Networking: A Top-Down Approach by Kurose and Ross
Computer Networks by Tanenbaum and Wetherall

cs.name: Software Engineering
cs.description: Software development methodologies and best practices

textbooks: Software Engineering by Ian Sommerville
Clean Code by Robert C. Martin

topics.content: State spaces, uninformed search (BFS, DFS, UCS)
Minimax, alpha-beta pruning, Monte Carlo tree search
Image processing, object recognition, deep learning

textbooks: Artificial Intelligence: A Modern Approach by Russell and Norvig
Pattern Recognition and Machine Learning by Bishop

topics.content: Types of learning, applications, Python/NumPy review

textbooks: The Elements of Statistical Learning by Hastie, Tibshirani, and Friedman
Pattern Recognition and Machine Learning by Bishop

topics.content: Type checking, attribute grammars, symbol tables
Stack allocation, heap management, garbage collection

textbooks: Compilers: Principles, Techniques, and Tools by Aho, Lam, Sethi, and Ullman
Engineering a Compiler by Cooper and Torczon

cs.name: Computer Security
cs.description: Security principles, cryptography, and secure systems

topics.content: CIA triad, threat models, security policies
Classical ciphers, modern cryptography, one-time pad
XSS, CSRF, SQL injection, OWASP top 10
Buffer overflows, secure coding, static analysis
Android/iOS security, app permissions, mobile threats

textbooks: Computer Security: Principles and Practice by Stallings and Brown
Security Engineering by Ross Anderson

topics.content: Regular expressions, pumping lemma, closure properties
CFGs, parse trees, ambiguity, normal forms
Pumping lemma for CFLs, closure properties

textbooks: Introduction to the Theory of Computation by Michael Sipser
Automata and Computability by Dexter Kozen

ee.name: Circuit Analysis I
ee.description: DC circuit analysis and basic circuit theorems

objectives: Analyze DC circuits using various methods

topics.content: RC and RL circuits, natural and step response
RLC circuits, overdamped, critically damped, underdamped

textbooks: Electric Circuits by Nilsson and Riedel
Microelectronic Circuits by Sedra and Smith

ee.name: Circuit Analysis II
ee.description: AC circuit analysis, frequency response, and power

topics.content: Nodal and mesh analysis with phasors
Average, reactive, complex power, power factor
Balanced systems, Y-Î” connections, power measurement
Transform pairs, circuit analysis in s-domain
Poles and zeros, stability, frequency response

textbooks: Electric Circuits by Nilsson and Riedel
Engineering Circuit Analysis by Hayt, Kemmerly, and Durbin

ee.name: Signals and Systems
ee.description: Signal analysis in time and frequency domains

topics.content: FIR and IIR design, windowing, bilinear transform

textbooks: Signals and Systems by Oppenheim and Willsky
Discrete-Time Signal Processing by Oppenheim and Schafer

topics.content: Coulomb's law, electric field, Gauss's law
Boundary conditions, capacitance, method of images
Integral and differential forms, boundary conditions

textbooks: Introduction to Electrodynamics by David Griffiths
Field and Wave Electromagnetics by David Cheng

topics.content: Energy bands, carriers, doping, drift and diffusion
DC analysis, bias stability, design considerations
Small-signal models, CE, CB, CC configurations
Structure, threshold voltage, channel length modulation
DC analysis, bias circuits, current sources
Small-signal models, CS, CG, CD configurations
Classes A, B, AB, efficiency, distortion

textbooks: Microelectronic Circuits by Sedra and Smith
Electronic Devices and Circuit Theory by Boylestad and Nashelsky
Digital Design and Computer Architecture by Harris and Harris
Digital Design by Morris Mano and Michael Ciletti

ee.name: Control Systems
ee.description: Analysis and design of feedback control systems

topics.content: Differential equations, transfer functions, block diagrams
First and second order systems, specifications
Construction rules, design using root locus
Bode plots, Nyquist plots, gain and phase margins
P, PI, PD, PID design and tuning
Design in frequency domain, cascade compensation
Optimal control, robust control, adaptive control

textbooks: Modern Control Engineering by Katsuhiko Ogata
Automatic Control Systems by Benjamin Kuo and Farid Golnaraghi

topics.content: Fourier analysis, power spectral density, correlation
Line codes, ISI, eye diagrams, equalization
ASK, FSK, PSK, QAM, constellation diagrams
Parity, CRC, Hamming codes, convolutional codes

textbooks: Communication Systems Engineering by Proakis and Salehi
Modern Digital and Analog Communication Systems by Lathi and Ding

ee.name: Power Systems
ee.description: Electric power generation, transmission, and distribution

topics.content: Symmetrical faults, unsymmetrical faults, sequence networks
Economic dispatch, unit commitment, optimal power flow
Harmonics, voltage sags, power factor correction

textbooks: Power System Analysis and Design by Glover, Sarma, and Overbye
Electric Power Systems by Weedy, Cory, Jenkins, and Ekanayake
The Definitive Guide to ARM Cortex-M3 and Cortex-M4 Processors by Joseph Yiu
Embedded Systems: Real-Time Interfacing to ARM Cortex-M by Jonathan Valvano

ee.name: VLSI Design
ee.description: CMOS VLSI design principles and methodologies

objectives: Use CAD tools for IC design

topics.content: DC characteristics, transient response, power dissipation
Static CMOS, ratioed logic, pass transistor logic
HDL synthesis, place and route, verification

textbooks: CMOS VLSI Design by Weste and Harris
Digital Integrated Circuits by Rabaey, Chandrakasan, and Nikolic

objectives: Use Smith charts and network analyzers

topics.content: S-parameters, ABCD parameters, signal flow graphs
Radiation patterns, gain, arrays, microstrip antennas
Free space, atmospheric effects, link budget

textbooks: Microwave Engineering by David Pozar
RF Circuit Design by Chris Bowick
